intro: Valeriana henrici, commonly known as Henrici's valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in late summer. Its root system is fibrous and contains compounds that have been traditionally used in herbal medicine. Valeriana henrici thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
